Office boy booked for filming women.description: PUNE: An office boy of a software company in Hinjewadi IT Park was booked on Friday for filming the women employees in the washroom. A software engineer (47), from Hinjewadi, spotted a cellphone on recording mode in the washroom. She raised an alarm and the company’s officials called police. Sub-inspector R P Bhawari of the Hinjewadi police said the cellphone was hidden between two tiles in the women’s washroom and switched on its camera. Before the police or company officials could take any action, the office boy grabbed his cellphone and ran away. Police said he was a resident of Parbhani district and had been employed with the company for the past eight months. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." In Video:CM Mamata accepts proposal of doctors to set up Grievance Redressal CellDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

\nSaraiwwalaa Agrr Refineries Limited in.description: Saraiwwalaa Agrr Refineries Limited (SARL), one of the leading edible oil companies as a part of their strategic growth introduced a new product under their flagship brand — Naturralle. SARL has strengthened their portfolio in edible oil sector by introducing “Naturralle Health Rice Bran Oil” for the health conscious consumers of today.  The brand is completely driven by market research and has always adapted to address the requirement and concern of the Indian households through innovation. The introduction of the Oil is a step towards fortifying the offerings under the brand. Anjani Kumar Gupta, director, SARL said, “The journey of brand has been amazing. It is our constant endeavour to introduce products that are good, convenient and healthier for our customers. According to studies, Indians are more prone to heart ailments. A product like rice bran oil with its high Oryzanol content improves the HDL/LDL ratio, making it one of the most heart-friendly oil. The product is aimed at the health conscious customer base — not only consumers with medical conditions, but also the health conscious segment which believes in eating right to prevent ailments.”  He further added, “At SARL we innovate and introduce the products that satisfy the needs of the ever evolving customers and make food taste better. With the addition of this product we are augmenting our portfolio with new products to suit the requirements of our customers. We plan innovative campaigns to reach out to the customers and make them aware about our brands. Our efforts have been recognised and World Consulting & Research Corporation (WCRC) has selected Naturralle as “Asia’s Most Promising Brand” for the second consecutive year. This certification brings to fore our journey as a brand which has shown tremendous growth in the past few years with focused efforts and innovative marketing strategies that have impacted the customers.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

New plants to process 400MT garbage dail.description: PUNE: The civic body’s daily garbage-processing capacity will soon increase by 400 metric tonnes (MT). The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), as a part of its plan to decentralize garbage-handling and stop dumping of unprocessed garbage at the Uruli depot before December 2019, will set up two 100MT plants and one 200MT plant. The 100MT plants will be set up at Ambegaon and Lohegaon, while the 200MT plant will come up at Uruli Devachi to process mixed garbage. The civic body will appoint private agencies to install, commission, operate, and maintain the plants. The sites for the site have already been identified, while sources in the civic body said the agencies will be appointed by next month. With processing mixed garbage a challenge, PMC had instructed housing societies, commercial establishments and hotels to treat wet garbage on their premises. But most of the new plants would be able to handle mixed garbage, officials said. “New plants will be set up in the fringes to deal with waste in effectively. Besides the newly proposed units, the civic body has already started work on a 750-tonne plant at Ramtekdi-Hadapsar,” a senior official from the solid waste management department said. Civic activists, meanwhile, claimed the PMC often plans to set up new processing units but neglects existing ones. They claimed many units across the city have been non-functional or working below half their capacities. Data obtained through an RTI petition, filed by Vivek Velankar of Sajag Nagrik Manch, revealed that the PMC was not able to operate the units at full capacity. “The PMC should ensure better functioning of the existing processing units,” Velankar said. Pune city generates about 2,000 tonnes of garbage every day. Of this, the civic body processes over 1,000 tonnes. Meanwhile, about 500 tonnes of waste is generated by the 11 newly merged villages, where the mechanism to process garbage daily is less than optimal. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Film highlights need to stop animal agri.description: PUNE: The internationally acclaimed documentary ‘Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret’ was screened on Sunday at the Indradhanushya Environment and Citizenship Centre in Rajendranagar. Organized by city-based environmentalist Madhavi Kolte, the 2014 documentary screening received a good response. The film is written and directed by Kip Andersen and Keegan Kuhn. It follows Andersen’s journey to uncover the magnitude and ignorance to animal agriculture, the prime reason causing global warming, in the green policies of giant environmental conglomerates. It also examines the urgent need for the world to adopt veganism. The screening was followed by an audience interaction over video call with the documentary’s executive producer Sailesh Rao, a renowned environmentalist and founder and executive director of a US-based non-profit organization working towards climate change. Rao, a systems specialist with a doctoral degree in electrical engineering, turned vegan in 2008 and has been propagating the cause ever since. Answering a question on the need to bring about change in school curriculum to highlight the problem, Rao said the narrative had to be changed. “The entire way of living has to change. In the present system, it is important to find a cure to heal our planet,” he said.  Nandita Shah, a doctor and founder-director of the NGO SHARAN, also addressed the audience. She converted to veganism in 1985. She said, “We have been brought up thinking we need animal products, or we are omnivores. It is time to eat according to instincts. Instinctively, we are herbivores and fructivores.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Japanese learners have wealth of opportu.description: By: Prajwal Channagiri Japanese companies coming to India is good news for professionals who can overcome the language barrier. Expertise in Japanese can fetch jobs in translation, interpretation, content writing, voiceover, bridge SEs, Japanese trainings, outbound processes, bilingual software testers, tourism, coordination through embassies and other services Many IT companies are ready to train non-technical people and get them started as business analysts, bilingual software testers and so on. Being able to speak Japanese will boost professional value in Japan and in India too. Japan also needs a young workforce in their companies. As per the estimates, Japan will need around six lakh engineers by 2030. The immediate need is for two lakh engineers and therefore, learning Japanese and working in a Japanese company, is a win-win situation. There are various recruiting platforms for Indian students such as Study Go Work Japan, Nikkei Asian Recruiting Forum and others. Study Go Work Japan and NARF both provide a free ticket to selected students for facing interviews in Japan. Additionally, in Study Go Work Japan program, free N4 and N3 education is given to engineering students and are enabled to get a job in Japan. This programme is run in association with Pune-based Japanese language institute, Hirameki Solutions. Gaining ProficiencyThe Japanese language proficiency test has five levels. It is a standardized criterion-referenced test to evaluate and certify Japanese language proficiency for non-native speakers, covering language knowledge, reading ability, and listening ability. N3 level is a minimum required level in the industry in order to bag a job in India or in Japan. One needs to dedicate at least one and a half years (8-10 hours a week) to be able to be proficient and converse in Japanese and crack JLPT (Japanese language proficiency test) N3 level. The writer is a Japanese language co-ordinator at the department of foreign languages at Savitribai Phule Pune UniversityDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. \nBrett Lee interacts with Puneites\n.description: Ace cricketer Brett Lee recently paid a visit to the Amanora Town Centre Mall where he spoke to a crowd of over 200 senior citizens about creating awareness on hearing disabilities. Present at the special occasion was Aditya Deshpande, Director-City Corporation Limited, who felicitated Lee. The event was a great success as the senior citizens enjoyed and keenly listened to the talk given by Lee along with a doctor who gave more details about the same.  Lee shared his experience of being the face for a multinational hearing aid company and how he is moved and touched by the way people are benefiting from the availability of the cochlear implant. He went on to talk about the benefits of this implant and how one can get back to their regular life without feeling less adequate in any area. The crowd enjoyed his presence to the fullest as he, with great joy, interacted with them on the topic of hearing loss and how it can be tackled.  Amanora Town Centre Mall has always been in the forefront for hosting CSR activities apart from a plethora of other engaging events. The mall’s high footfall ensures that maximum visitors can avail the benefit of these activities.  Some of the other events lined up this month at Amanora Town Centre Mall include the Skateboard Jam with Andy Anderson on April 17, Robotics Summer Camp for kid’s on April 23-24 and the Hola 5.0 Flea Market on April 30 and May 1. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Narendra Modi.description: NEW DELHI: Urging the opposition to stop worrying about numbers, PM Modi on Monday said every word of the opposition was important and all efforts should be made for a " nishpaksh" (non-partisan) approach to issues of public welfare and the larger interest of India. His remarks at the start of the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha echo his announcement on Sunday of a meeting of leaders of all parties and an informal interaction of MPs, in what is seen as a bid to break the ice after a bitter poll campaign. "The opposition should stop worrying about numbers. The people have given them a certain number. Every word of the opposition is important. When it comes to Parliament, we should forget the ruling side and opposition. We should think of issues with a nishpaksh spirit," Modi said. The Prime Minister said an active and effective opposition is a necessity in a democracy and pointed out that a well- argued and factual criticism of the government strengthens democracy. "Sometimes such positive contributions are not noticed as they do not get high TRPs," he said. Though he did not mention the media, he said highlighting such efforts would strengthen the functioning of Parliament. Modi noted that the recent elections have yielded several firsts such as the highest number of voters exercising their franchise since Independence, a high number of women voters and a higher representation for women in Parliament. "It is also after several decades that a government has been re-elected with a bigger majority," he said. Referring to his recent speeches, the Prime Minister said that "we started with ' sab ka saath, sab ka vikas', but the people have added an unprecedented 'vishwas' (trust) to the matter". He said Monday marks the the start of the first session after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. "I welcome all new MPs. With them comes new hope, new aspirations and new determination to serve," he said. In Video:Oppositions' every word is valuable: PM Narendra ModiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Cops forced to intervene as unruly fans.description: PUNE: Police resorted to a mild lathi charge on Sunday night to free up Fergusson College Road after cricket fans in their hundreds ignored instructions to move off the thoroughfare. FC Road was the scene of chaotic celebrations, as fans in their hundreds had flocked there in the wake of India’s World Cup victory against Pakistan. Things soon got out of hand, with some of them climbing atop cars and even public transport buses. The mob also took over the thoroughfare, causing the traffic to come to a standstill. That was when the police stepped in — they dispersed the unruly elements of the crowd with a lathicharge, freeing up the roads for traffic. Cricket enthusiasts started gathering on FC Road and the adjacent Jangli Maharaj Road as soon as play resumed after the final rain interruption on Sunday night. By then, it had become apparent that India were headed for big win — Pakistan needed 136 runs from just five overs. Revellers in cars, motorcycles and scooters came roaring in, shouting slogans and waving the Indian flag. “As is the case always, the city traffic police and the local police stations of Deccan Gymkhana and Shivajinagar closed Fergusson College Road to traffic,” a senior police officer told TOI. “However, before the road was barricaded, some four-wheelers and two-wheelers drove onto the rode and were parked there,” the officer said. Fans shouted, raised slogans and burst firecrackers. Some of them played loud music in their cars, while others danced on top of cars, police said. The revellers celebrated the emphatic win for hours. “We allowed them to celebrate, but, at the same time, we wanted to open the road to traffic,” the officer said. “We requested the fans revellers at Sambhaji Bridge, Good Luck Chowk, and the stretch between Vaishali restaurant and Fergusson College’s main gate to disperse. However, they ignored our entreaties and continued to dance and created a ruckus.” Soon, police vans reached the area and some revellers cleared off. A few minutes later, most of them had dispersed, daunted by the police presence. “We thought we could finally restore vehicular movement on the road, but within minutes, the unruly fans had come back on the road,” the officer added. Around 1.15am on Monday, police called for reinforcements on FC Road and quick response team rushed to the spot. “We used the public address system to disperse the crowd, but nobody budged,” the officer said. He said they were left with no choice but to use lathis on the crowd. “Once the police raised their lathis, the crowd dispersed and did not return,” the officer said. Some time later, a vehicle made the rounds of JM Road and other adjoining roads and found that the fans had cleared out from there too. The officer said they were not against such celebrations, as long as they were within limits. “Nobody, including police, can stop people from celebrating such occasions. But at the same time, people should be mindful of the law. We requested them to leave the road for the convenience of others, but they did not heed us. In such a situation, we retorted to a mild lathicharge. No one was injured,” the officer said. Civic activists voiced their support to the police and said the authorities must exercise their power and keep things under control; law and order should be the first priority, they said. “Tough action should be taken against those indulging in hooliganism. Celebrations are welcome, but should not create a nuisance,” said Vivek Velankar of Sajag Nagrik Manch, a citizens’ group. Just like police officials strictly monitor those seeking permission for public rallies or events, Velankar said the standards must be applied to such celebrations. “Offenders should not be spared,” he said. “The governing authorities, including police, need to sensitize people. Things can go wrong quickly if the mob goes out of control. Better coordination between the civic administration and the police department is must so that public places are not misused in the name of celebration,” said Vijay Kumbhar of Surajya Sangharsha Samitee, a citizens’ group. Pune cop action against loud hotels, pub.description: PUNE: The crime branch of the Pune police on Friday night filed cases against eight pubs and hotels for playing loud music well after the deadline, disturbing the peace in Mundhwa and Hadapsar. The establishments were playing music on loudspeakers after 10.30pm — the deadline for using them. A team comprising assistant commissioner of police (crime) Bhanupratap Barge, inspector Datta Chavan, sub-inspector Santosh Tasgaon and others were on patrol, passing by the party joints, when they heard loud music. The police filed cases against the outlets under the provisions of the Maharashtra Police Rules. Barge said they would continue the drive on weekends, and hotels and pubs would not be allowed to play loud music after the 10.30pm deadline. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Five held for robbing man of Rs 3.17 lak.description: PUNE: A five-member gang was arrested on Sunday for attacking Sudhakar Kshirsagar (37) from Adarshnagar and robbing him of Rs3.17 lakh around 1.30pm on Friday. The police have also detained their two minor accomplices and seized Rs1.08 lakh and an autorickshaw used for the robbery. The arrested suspects include Yerawada residents Akash Sankpal (20), Omkar Sonawane (20), Kunal Jadhav (19), Prajjwal Kadam (19) and Arjun Maske (19). Kshirsagar works for a money transfer firm. “He was going to his office after collecting cash from traders when the suspects accosted him. They were arguing, when three others arrived. Two suspects tried to snatch the bag with the cash. When Kshirsagar resisted, one of them hit him on the head with a blunt object. They then fled with the bag and his two cellphones,” said inspector Ajay Waghmare of the Yerawada police. The suspects were arrested from an under-construction building at Laxminagar after sub-inspector Mangesh Bhange received a tip-off. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Cabinet expansion: Ex-congre.description: MUMBAI: Former Congressman and Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Sunday joined the cabinet of chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. Vikhe Patil, who joined as a minister, was administered the oath of office and secrecy by governor CV Rao at a function in Raj Bhavan. Also inducted was a long-time contender, Mumbai Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Ashish Shelar. With this, Fadnavis has consolidated the BJP's position before the upcoming assembly elections. Over a dozen ministers are expected to take the oath on Sunday from various parties of the ruling alliance including BJP, Shiv Sena, Republican Party of India (A). Anantnag Encounter.description: SRINAGAR: An Army Major died while another officer of the same rank and two soldiers were injured in a gunfight at Bidoora village, in Achabal area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district, on Monday, a defence spokesman said. A Pakistani terrorist was killed in the encounter. Major Ketan Sharma of 19 Rashtriya Rifles, who died in the Achabal encounter, belonged to Meerut. A police officer said they had found the body of a Pakistani terrorist and seized arms and ammunition from the encounter site. The identity of the slain terrorist was being ascertained. In another attack, at least nine Army soldiers were injured in an IED blast that targeted a security vehicle of 44 RR at Aarihal village in Pulwama on Monday evening. Those injured in the Achabal gunfight and IED blast were rushed to the Army's 92 Base hospital in Srinagar, officials said. In the third attack in 24 hours, terrorists lobbed a grenade at the headquarters of the 180 CRPF battalion camp in Tral sub-district of Pulwama late on Monday evening. The grenade exploded outside the headquarters. No casualties have been reported. The first attack happened on Monday morning when a team of security men was on a cordon-and-search operation in Achabal. Terrorists fired at the team, who then retaliated. In the Pulwama attack, the terrorists after setting off the IED, opened fire at the Army vehicle. "Initial reports reveal the vehicle suffered extensive damage," the official said. Three of the soldiers injured in the blast were said to be serious, sources said. Soon after the attack, Army, police and SOG reinforcements were rushed to the spot and a massive search operation was launched. A defence spokesman, however, said some of the men sustained minor injuries in the IED blast. Damage was minimal due to the alertness of the patrol party, he said. The vehicle was an armoured ALS and not a Casspir (a mine-resistant, ambush-protected vehicle), he added. Pune police raid 6 pubs, seize liquor wo.description: PUNE: For the second straight night, officers from the Pune police crime branch raided six pubs and restaurants for playing loud music and serving liquor illegally. The police carried out the drive between midnight and 2.30am on Baner Road, Yerawada and Bund Garden Road and seized liquor worth Rs4.51 lakh. The team comprised assistant commissioner of police (crime) Bhanupratap Barge, assistant police inspector Ashwini Jagtap, sub-inspector Satish Walke, and constables Sunil Pawar, Shankar Sampate, Mauli Pawar and others. According to the norms, playing loud music in public places is illegal after 10.30pm. Barge said that all these places were found playing loud music, well above the prescribed decibel levels, at the time. Initially, police raided four restaurants and pubs in the Bund Garden Road area. These commercial establishments were found playing loud music. Cases against these establishments have been filed at the Bund Garden police station, officers said. Following this, the team raided a pub located in Yerawada, where they found the establishment selling serving liquor illegally to its patrons. The police seized 49 bottle of liquor worth Rs1.01 lakh from the spot. A case against the pub has been filed at the Yerawada police station. Later, the police raided a pub-cum-lounge on Baner Road, around 2.30am. There too, the police discovered the establishment playing loud music as well as was serving liquor illegally. They then seized bottles of liquor worth Rs3.50 lakh and registered a case against the pub’s management at the Chatushrungi police station. ACP Barge said police will continue to raid such establishments if they are violating norms and not adhering to the 10.30pm deadline curbing the use of loudspeakers. “They must adhere to the rules,” he said. Onset of monsoon over Mumbai likely by t.description: MUMBAI/PUNE: After a prolonged delay, the onset of the south-west monsoon over the city is expected by the weekend. Weathermen said scattered rain in Mumbai was only “convective activity”. While the normal date for the onset is June 10, it has been delayed this year. Last week, due to Cyclone Vayu in the Arabian Sea, the city received significant showers. But with the weakening of the system, conditions are now becoming favourable for further advance of the south-west monsoon into more parts of the country. In the city, rainfall recorded since June 1 by IMD Colaba observatory was 101mm, while at Santa Cruz, it was 140mm. The rain departure in case of Colaba and Santa Cruz was -126.9 and -60.9 respectively. “While surface winds are favourable (southwesterly), the wind pattern needs support till mid-level, which is currently lagging. Conditions are becoming favourable for the further onset of monsoons in 4-5 days,” said Shubhangi Bhute, scientist, IMD Mumbai. On when the onset was expected over Mumbai, she said it may take 2-3 days to reach southern parts of Konkan, and thereafter to Mumbai around June 20-21. Rainfall was reported from many parts of the city on Monday, but the showers were short-lived. “Lower level winds are incurring the moisture, hence we are witnessing convective activity, but it has to sustain the monsoon pattern, which is lagging. We are waiting for sufficient moisture in the atmosphere,” she added. Convection in the atmosphere is the way air floats up on account of being warmer than surrounding air. Maximum temperatures in the city continued to remain on the higher side on Monday hovering around 34 degrees Celsius. Private forecasting agency Skymet on Monday said a spell of rain is likely over coastal parts of Maharashtra between June 23-26. Isolated heavy to very heavy rain is also likely. IMD (Pune) said the monsoon is expected to reach Maharashtra in four to five days, with chances of heavy rainfall at isolated places in Konkan and Goa on Wednesday. Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather, IMD (Pune) said the monsoon was set to enter parts of south Konkan and south Maharashtra by June 20-21, and may cover the entire state by June 24-25. said its entry into Mumbai will be known in few days. (With inputs from Neha Madaan)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Forays into deep space fuel interest in.description: Pune: Space exploration has taken a giant leap with interest among students in astronomy and related fields going up.  Expertise in physics is the easiest way to make a career in astronomy. Tarun Souradeep, senior professor at IUCAA, said during his time, the engineering syllabus had a much broader view which allowed him to move to physics for a master’s degree. “It is not the case any more as engineering has become much more focused. I do not believe that you need a specialized course in astrophysics or such in the undergraduate level to become an astrophysicist. What is required is a good fundamental knowledge of physics as everything is eventually an applied version of physics.” Sukanta Bose, science lead of the LIGO-India Project, said while pure physics in graduation will do, there is a need for a master’s thesis as well as smaller projects in the astronomy related field during the postgraduate course if a student wishes to have a career in astronomy. “Centres like IUCAA are mandated by the University Grants Commission to expand astronomy courses in Indian universities so that at least when graduating there is enough representation of astronomy among other sciences. We are currently in process of working with Savitribai Phule Pune University to have students enrolled in MSc Physics do something exclusively in astrophysics for their master’s thesis,” Bose said. Varun Bhalerao, assistant professor at IIT Bombay said even if a student is unable to make a career in astrophysics despite taking up physics in their masters and PhD course, he or she can get a job in industries as they too are opening up their recruitment drives to students with a PhD. But he advises students to make sure that their PhDs are on a good subject and from a good institute. “A PhD in physics means you have taken up a problem which nobody has solved as yet. In the years of research, you are solving the problem and submitting your research for your PhD degree. Industries also want people with excellent fundamental knowledge who can solve problems innovatively and research students fit the bill. While there is a huge difference in the recruitment of PhD students in foreign countries, the Indian industry is opening up too,” Bhalerao said. Bhalerao who took up engineering for his bachelor’s degree says despite his course work, he made sure that he kept himself up-to-date with physics and did projects in the astronomy sector. “But I got a lot of rejections when I was applying for my research in astrophysics because there were students of physics who were always given preference. Hence, if a student knows that he or she wants a career in astrophysics, it is always better to take physics in the undergraduation and specialize along with mathematics, computers and statistics,” Bhalerao added. Arvind Paranjpye, director of Nehru Planetarium, said in the present scenario, engineering students have an option of doing PhD with Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) after graduation through the Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology. "With the kind of leap ISRO is taking, the basics of space science should come down to primary level. Astronomy should be taken to schools. These days small kits and models are available for space-related things which could be introduced at the school level itself," Paranjpye said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pune: 21 women rescued from Budhwar Peth.description: PUNE: The Faraskhana police on Sunday raided three brothels in Budhwar Peth and rescued 21 women who were forced into prostitution. A team led by senior inspector Kishore Navande arrested two women under sections 344 (wrongful confinement for ten or more days), 366-B (importing girls from foreign country) of the IPC and relevant sections of the Prevention of Immoral Trafficking Act (PITA). The rescued women include some from Nepal and Bangladesh, a Faraskhana police officer said. The police were informed that women were being forced into prostitution in a few brothels in Budhwar Peth area. “We sent teams and raided three brothels in Budhwar Peth on Sunday evening. The women were sent to the rescue home,” the officer said. Two women were arrested for forcing the women into prostitution. Meanwhile, the social security cell of the Pune crime branch late on Saturday night busted a sex racket in Narhe and rescued two women. The police have arrested two men under relevant sections of the PITA. A police team led by inspector Manisha Zende made the arrests. Last week, sex workers demanded that provisions of Immoral Trafficking (Prevention) Act (1956) not be misused by authorities against adult women working voluntarily in the field. A fact-finding team was put together to study the surge in police raids and nakabandi operations that have witnessed a surge from January to April this year. The survey was conducted by Saheli Sangh, a city-based sex workers’ rights organization, along with People’s Union for Civil Liberties and Mahila Sarvangeen Utkarsh Mandal, a rural feminist organization. Chanchal Lahiri.description: KOLKATA: After a day-long search for magician Chanchal Lahiri (41),   who disappeared   while performing an underwater escape act in the Hooghly, police on Monday fished out his body from near Howrah. Later in the evening, Lahiri's brother identified his body. An initial police probe established that Lahiri on Sunday had made several mistakes while attempting the stunt popularised by the famous illusionist and stunt performer Harry Houdini almost 100 years ago. Mandrake trying similar stunt earlierMMiC still in shock after magician’s deathLahiri, who was to come out of the water after being thrown in with his hands and feet bound, , but also wore cumbersome clothing and guards that made swimming in the strong current extremely difficult. Magician PC Sarkar, a master of such stunts, said perhaps Lahiri "needed a little more practice". Lahiri's team, too, waited about 15 minutes after he was lowered into the water to raise an alarm. Chanchal Lahiri on the boat moments before he started the stunt on Sunday Lahiri’s hands and legs were tied with ropes and he was chained with six locks. "When he did not surface for a long time, people panicked. Some onlookers said they saw a man struggling, seeking help, in the middle of the river. Police were informed and a team of divers from the disaster management group joined the rescue operation," said DC (Port) Syed Waquar Raza. Cops will probe if he took advantage of some lacunae on part of the administration and probably paid for it with his life. "A case of negligence is likely to be registered," said a source. Lahiri being lowered into the Hooghly river as he performed one of his tricks in KolkataMagician’s body found; peers say he didn’t take proper precaution Sources said Mandrake never mentioned in his permission letter that he was going to jump into the water. "Lahiri stated the stunt was to happen on a boat or vessel. Hence, we allowed him permission," Raza said. The letter added that he wanted to take photographs and perform an extra event around 1.30pm. The final dip made by Chanchal Lahiri"He performed almost an hour earlier. Hence, river traffic police was absent," said a Port division officer. Police said Lahiri drowned around 12.30pm and it is unclear whether he was performing or practising the act. Moments before the stunt on Sunday, Lahiri said, "If you perform a dangerous trick perfectly, you are a magician. If you fail, it is always tragic." Mandrake's body was fished out on Monday"Bound and chained, Mandrake was lowered 30 feet under water. Thousands watched and it is impossible the cops missed the entire episode when even politicians were present," claimed a friend on Monday. In 2013, when Lahiri performed the same stunt, he was assaulted by the crowd of onlookers, who claimed they felt cheated because they had seen through the trick. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man dies, two others hurt as bikes colli.description: PUNE: A 28-year-old man from Bhor was killed and two others including a minor boy sustained injuries, after their motorcycles collided head-on, in the Bopdev Ghat section on Saturday night. The deceased was identified as Rupesh Shilimkar (28) of Bhor. The injured — Ganesh Kiwale (23) of Purandar and his nephew Saurabh Jagdale (13) — are being treated in a private hospital. None of them were wearing helmets. An officer from the Kondhwa police said Kiwale and Jadgale were returning home after closing the former’s stationery shop and Shilimkar was going towards Khadi Machine Chowk via Bopdev Ghat. “Their motorcycles collided head-on near a private college in the ghat section,” the officer said. The three of them fell off and Shilimkar died on the spot. “We have booked Kiwale for negligent driving,” the officer said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MahaRERA slaps penalty of over Rs 1cr on.description: PUNE: The MahaRERA’s Pune bench has passed an ex parte order directing realty company Yemul and Sancheti Associates to pay over Rs 1 crore, along with the accrued interest, to petititoner Manjusha Bhusari whom the realty company owed a flat but could not complete construction despite missing several deadlines. The Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority’s (MahaRERA) order came after Bhusari presented to the court that she intended to withdraw from the project. “The respondents (developers) shall pay the amounts within 30 days from the date of this order,” adjudicating officer W K Kanbarkar wrote in his order on May 31, 2019. The realty company had purchased the complainant’s land in Hadapsar to construct a building on the land for an agreed consideration of Rs3.75 crore. But except for Rs 25 lakh, the money was never paid to the complainant. The realty firm pledged a flat of Rs1 crore in the Sadashiv Peth area, but it was not completed either, the order stated. “The total outstanding from Yemul and Sancheti was Rs3.5 crore. But he was not in position to pay it back. Hence the builders approached Dyaneshwar Bhusari (husband of Manjusha Bhusari) offering them a flat worth Rs1 crore in another project going on in the Sadashiv Peth area,” law firm, VV Mahadik and Associates, representing the petitioner said in an email reply to TOI. Yemul and Sancheti Associates has also put the order on the MahaRERA website in the complaints details section. The realtors had also paid a Rs1 lakh penalty for delayed registration on the project. “We have appealed the order in the Mumbai office of MahaRERA and the next hearing is scheduled on June 19, 2019. We will keep you updated,” Yemul and Sancheti Associates said in an email reply. Bhusari’s lawyer said that they have also filed a petition for the balance Rs2.5 crore. “The balance Rs2.5 crore is (also) outstanding, for which the complaint is under adjudication authority and the hearing is in the month of July 2019,” VV Mahadik and Associates wrote in the reply. Scooter rider flouts no-entry rule, caus.description: PUNE: A woman (55) died as she came under the wheels of a truck and her husband was injured after he failed to balance his two-wheeler while avoiding collision with a scooter speeding in from the wrong direction of the road near Chandni Chowk on Saturday night. The Kothrud police said the accident occurred around 10.30pm on the steep slope connecting Chandni Chowk to Paud Road. A resident of the Siddhivinayak Krupa society, Surekha Pradeep Wani was critically injured and was taken to Sassoon General Hospital. Doctors in the hospital declared her dead on arrival. Her husband, Pradeep Wani (64), was injured in his leg while trying to avert the collision. The police have arrested the truck driver for negligent driving. The scooterist who had flouted the rule fled the spot. On Sunday, Wani told TOI that he had gone to a friend’s house in Bavdhan with his wife, their two sons and daughters-in-law for dinner on Saturday. “We usually travel together in car. But we went to Bavdhan on our two-wheelers because one of my sons had bought tickets for a play after the dinner,” he said. Around 10.30pm, Wani and his wife left Bavdhan for home on his two-wheeler. “I was descending the slope near Chandni Chowk to reach Paud Road. I suddenly spotted a man on a white scooter speeding in from the opposite direction towards Chandni Chowk,” he said. “The person was riding along the wrong side of the road, which is not only narrow but is also dangerous because of the steep slope. I started shouting at the scooterist to alert him that he was violating the wrong-side rule. He, however, paid no attention and kept on speeding,” Wani said. “All that I remember that a multi-axle truck was passing by us. I cannot recall what happened at that moment. I felt a jerk in the scooter and my wife fell on the right side of the road. Her left leg and hand came under the wheels of the heavily loaded truck,” he said. The accident survivor said despite all his attempts, he could not remove Surekha out of the truck. “She remained stuck under the wheels of the truck and kept on looking at me helplessly. Someone contacted the police and ambulance,” Wani said. A police team reached the spot and managed to remove Surekha from the spot. She was taken to the Sassoon hospital, where the doctors pronounced her dead on arrival. Kothrud police inspector Shankar Khatke told TOI that the Mumbai-bound truck was also descending the slope. “We have arrested the truck driver,” he said. The left side of the slope that connects Chandni Chowk to Paud Road has been dug up for the ongoing Chandni Chowk flyover work. The road is already narrow and has become more risky, especially during night hours, because of the flyover work. The police have restricted the entry of vehicles from Paud Road to avoid accidents. However, many people violate the rule to avoid a detour to reach Bavdhan. Kothrud traffic branch inspector Ajay Chandkhede said, “A team of Kothrud police has been deployed where the slope connects the bypass during day time. Similarly, a team of Warje police is deployed at Chandni chowk. We are regularly taking action against the people violating the no-entry rule.” Wrong-side driving has become rampant across the city, leading to quite a few accidents across the city (see graphic). Inspector Khatke said as per police commissioner K Venkatesham’s directions, action was being taken against the wrong-side drivers under Section 279 (rash driving) of the Indian Penal Code. If convicted under the section, a driver can be fined Rs1,000 or face imprisonment for up to six months, or both. On June 6, the traffic branch had taken action against 67 motorists for wrong-side driving. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Demand for tankers in Maharashtra shoots.description: PUNE: The unprecedented water crisis in Maharashtra has pushed up the requirement for tankers in the state to 7,000 this week. Officials said around 8,000 tankers may be required in the next few days unless rains arrive in the state by next week. Two years ago, chief minister Fadnavis had set a target of making Maharashtra tanker-free by 2019 under the flagship initiative Jalyukt Shivar. State relief and rehabilitation officials said, since the state has been facing severe drought and water shortage, demand for tankers has gone up even as adequate mitigation measures have been put in place. Officials said the requirement for tankers this year has been the highest in the last many years. Fadnavis recently directed senior bureaucrats to visit water-parched areas to review the implementation of various schemes. He also directed the government to undertake repair and restoration of water supply schemes and acquisition of wells in affected areas on a priority basis. The state government has now deployed the highest number of water tankers — 6,905 as of June 15 — to meet the drinking water needs of the parched region. This is more than three times the number of tankers (1,801) deployed around this time last year. In 2016, around 6,000 tankers were deployed due to deficient monsoon. ‘Poor rainfall increased the tanker requirements in all places. Even schemes such as Jal Yukt Shivar Abhiyan could not be started due to poor rainfall last year,’’ stated senior officials from the relief and rehabilitation department. The official further added that they would be ready with another 1,000 tankers in the days to come with private operators from every district roped in to meet the requirement. Nearly 5,506 villages have been affected and they are now entirely dependent on water tankers for their daily needs. The Marathwada region is the worst hit with maximum number of tankers deployed in the area. In all, 3,492 tankers have been deployed in Aurangabad division, while around 1,000 tankers are in operation in Pune and Nashik divisions. Jalna has the highest number of tankers in operation at 1,157, Aurangabad has 1,129 in operation daily, according to officials from the relief and rehabilitation department. Altogether 778 villages are completely dependent on tankers in Aurangabad, while 549 villages are affected in Jalna followed by 666 villages in Beed, where 960 tankers are in operation. The water scarcity has also hit livestock, with about 10 lakh animals sheltered in cattle camps. Of the 17 major reservoirs listed by the Central Water Commission (CWC), with a total live capacity of 14.073 billion cubic metres, the live storage until June first week was 5.5%. “Parts of Marathwada and North Maharashtra are among the worst-affected. In around 2,000 villages across the state, the groundwater levels were found to be more than 3 metres lower than the five-year average. The Maharashtra Groundwater (Development and Management) Act needs to be amended soon to regulate extraction of water,’’ said an activist. Last week, the chief minister had sanctioned a Rs-30-crore proposal for cloud-seeding experiments in dam catchment areas of Marathwada, North Maharashtra, and Vidarbha. “We will carry out experiments after taking due guidance from the experts,” stated the officials from relief and rehabilitation department. The state had carried out cloud-seeding experiments in 1992 in the catchment areas, which supply water to Mumbai. In 2015, too, the state had conducted the experiments and said that they were able to induce 1300 mm rainfall. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No representation for Pune as Dilip Kamb.description: PUNE: Sunday’s state cabinet expansion has come as good news for Maval but brought dismay for Pune. The city which sent eight BJP MLAs to the assembly and had two ministers till recently will now be deprived of any ministerial representation. Dilip Kamble, the only ministerial representative from Pune, was dropped in the reshuffle effected on Sunday. Kamble, who represents Pune Cantonment assembly constituency, was the minister of state for social justice and special assistance. The other minister, Girish Bapat, who was elected as Member of Parliament recently, resigned from the state assembly. He was the minister for food, civil supplies and consumer protection, food and drugs administration, parliamentary affairs in the Devendra Fadnavis government. “I was among the first 10 state ministers who took oath as soon as the government was formed in 2014. I am happy with my tenure and grateful to the party and the chief minister for the opportunity to work as a minister,” Kamble told TOI on Sunday. During his tenure, he took some landmark decisions that will help youngsters from the deprived classes in the long run, he said. They include ease of providing caste certificates, scholarships for international studies and building hostels for needy students. The minister had courted controversy over some remarks which he had later backtracked after public anger swelled. He was embroiled in an alleged case of corruption. The police, acting on directives from the court, had registered a case against him and four others for allegedly cheating a trader by promising him two liquor shop licences. Kamble said controversies would happen with people in public life and he has moved on. He added that he would come out clean. The opposition parties have expressed surprise over leaving out Pune without minister to represent it. The BJP on the other hand claimed that the cabinet changes will not adversely impact the city’s development. “Pune is the second biggest city after Mumbai and not having a single minister is strange. Such a big metropolis must have a ministerial representative. It helps in putting forward the issues of the city and generating funds for development works,” Ramesh Bagwe, city unit chief of Congress and former state minister, said. Several BJP leaders in the city said the reshuffle and the absence of any representative from Pune will not affect the development projects in the city. “The decision to make changes in the state cabinet is taken at the chief minister’s office level. They must have thought out a policy and made some calculations before taking the call. The changes will not create any obstacle in the decision-making process for city. It will also not hamper development works,” Yogesh Gogawale, city unit chief of BJP, said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Civic body\u2019s report on de-reservati.description: PUNE: The town planning department of Pune Municipal Corporation will submit its report on the controversial de-reservation of garden land in Baner by the end of the month. On Sunday, the department’s officials — accompanied by residents opposing the de-reservation move — had carried a survey of the land in question. “A decision on the proposed reservation will be taken by the state government. Before the process was to be completed, suggestions and objections were invited from the citizens. We held a hearing in that regard. After that, a site visit was organized,” Avinash Patil, joint director of town planning, told TOI. He said that report on the process carried out by his department is to be drafted. It will be submitted to the state government within around a fortnight’s time. A chunk of land in Murkute Garden in Baner has been slated for de-reservation. After the de-reservation, around 1.6 lakh soft will be available for construction. The market price of the plot is around Rs40 crore. This has been under process for the past two years. The move has attracted controversy, with a group of residents opposing it. The residents even carried out a signature campaign last August. The residents had claimed that ideally, 16 hectares should be reserved for the Baner-Balewadi area. But currently, they have only 8.37 hectares. The owner of the land, on the other hand, has supported the conversion of the land from garden to residential zone, saying ample space was available for the garden purposes. Baner-Balewadi has around 18 gardens. But most are unused. “My ancestors have already given over 85,000 ares for gardens in this area. That space is sufficient and the garden built on it has adequate facilities for nearby areas,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PCMC smart city office to cost Rs 2.36 c.description: PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation will develop a smart city office at an estimated cost of Rs2.36 months. The project is expected to take three months to complete, civic officials said. Contractors interested in bidding for the project would have to visit the site to get an idea of the work required and accordingly prepare tender documents, city engineer Rajan Patil has said. To ensure the specified quality of work, which will also include the necessary surveys, temporary work, the contractors will need to prepare a quality assurance plan and get the same approved by the engineer-in-charge within one month. “The contractor would have to take all necessary measures to manage traffic during the construction and provide, erect, and maintain such barricades as per drawings and design, including signs and markings as may be required by the engineer for information and protection of motorists on the section of the highway under improvement,” a civic official said. \nNaseeruddin Shah and Kamal Haasan at t.description: One of the highlights of the closing ceremony of the second edition of Film Preservation and Restoration Workshop 2016, organised by Film Heritage Foundation, was the discussions on the importance of conserving the country’s movie legacy. The 10-day workshop, co-organised by Viacom 18 and hosted at The National Film Archive of India in Pune, saw major Indian and international experts gather together to discuss, conduct and promote the urgent need to preserve India’s rich film legacy. Prominent film personalities including Naseeruddin Shah and Kamal Haasan, and Sunil Arora (Secretary in Ministry of Information and Broadcasting) were present for the opening and closing ceremonies along with Shivendra Singh Dungarpur (Founder Director, Film Heritage Foundation) and Sudhanshu Vats (Group CEO, Viacom18 Media Pvt Ltd). The dignitaries also pledged their support by being the chief guests of honour for the Film Preservation and Restoration Workshop 2016. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

District officials finalize plot for Bop.description: PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: The district collector’s office will give land to the defence authorities in Yerawada in return for land in Khadki, to facilitate the construction of the Bopkhel bridge and approach roads. The Chinchwad BJP MLA Laxman Jagtap said the decision to give this land was taken at a meeting recently. “The state government’s 4-acre land will be given to the defence authorities,” he said. Rajan Patil, the city engineer of Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC), said, “We have invited bids for the bridge’s construction. The proposal to seek approval for appointing a contractor to construct the bridge will be sent to the standing committee by the month-end.” Pramod Ombase, the executive engineer of PCMC, told TOI, “The civic body will construct a 1,818m bridge which will include approach roads of 209m on the Pune-side and 75m on the Bopkhel side. The total width of the bridge will be 8.4m with a carriage width of 7.5m. There is no footpath as the defence authorities did not allow it. The bridge will be constructed in two years after the work is allotted to the contractor.” The Bopkhel village has a population of 21,000 people and is located along the Mula river. It was merged with the PCMC limits in 1997. It is surrounded by the defence land of College of Military Engineering (CME) on three sides and Mula river on the fourth side. Earlier, it was linked to the Pune-Mumbai highway in Dapodi via a 2.25km road which passed through the CME defence land. But it was closed in May 2015 on the directives of the high court for security concerns. The villagers conducted an agitation. Later, the defence authorities put up a pontoon bridge on Mula river in June 2015 to provide access to the Bopkhel residents to Khadki, but removed it in June 2016. As a result, the villagers have to first go to the Bopkhel phata on the Pune-Alandi Road and then go to their destination in Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad. The villagers conducted hunger strikes and agitations for the early construction of an alternate road to link Bopkhel to Khadki by constructing a bridge on Mula river. Rajendra Pawar, defence estate officer (DEO), Pune circle had sent a letter to the PCMC in April 2018 stating that the value of the land needed for bridge and road for Bopkhel was Rs25.81crore. Meanwhile, Mangala Ghule, the former Pimpri Chinchwad city organizer, told the government to arrange for land for the defence authorities in lieu of the defence land, for four months. In January 2019, the high court directed the PCMC to start the road construction in two weeks as a result the PCMC invited bids for the project. Gulab Bhalerao, executive president Bopkhel Gaon Rasta Sangharsha Samiti said, “We want the bridge and road construction to be completed at the earliest.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lawyer crossed limits in \u2018advising\.description: PUNE: Special public prosecutor Prakash Suryavanshi on Monday told a special UAPA court that Mumbai lawyer Sanjiv Punalekar had crossed the “Laxman Rekha” (limits) while advising shooter Sharad Kalaskar to dismantle the firearms used to shoot dead rationalist Narendra Dabholkar on August 20, 2013. Opposing Punalekar’s bail plea on CBI’s behalf, Suryavanshi argued that the Punalekar’s advice is not legal and his acts are not protected under Section 126 (professional communication) of the Evidence Act. He submitted that this is not a simple case under section 201 (destroying evidence) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). Investigations have revealed that Punalekar has aided and abetted Kalaskar, Suryawanshi said. The CBI’s reply opposing the bail plea said it has found that Punalekar gave shelter to an accused in the Goa blast in his residential building at Mumbai thus aiding and abetting murder and his acts also fall under the terrorist act under section 15 of the Unlawful (Activities) Prevention Act (UAPA). The prosecution will continue with its arguments on June 19. Earlier, Suryavanshi told the judge R M Pande that a lawyer can give legal advice to his client like surrendering himself before the police, filing anticipatory bail plea and filing petition for quashing the case. Punalekar’s advice to Kalaskar, he said, to dismantle firearms is not protected under the Evidence Act. Relying on Dabholkar’s wife Shaila’s statement, Suryvanshi said, “The victim’s husband was receiving threats from Sanatan Sanshta because they were opposed to his ideology. The threats said Dabholkar would be the second Gandhi to be killed. A newspaper published by sanstha shows a man lying on a floor with a flag pierced in his chest, two days before Dabholkar was shot dead. It shows that the suspects wanted to kill him.” The prosecutor read the confessional statement of Kalaskar referring to Punalekar as the sanstha’s sadak instead of lawyer who had instructed him to destroy the weapons and motorcycle used in the Dabholkar case. “Kalaskar’s confession is prima facie admissible because his statement was recorded by an IPS officer. The defence has said that the lawyer’s act was a privileged communication protected under section 201 of the IPC but the CBI has arrested him for committing an offence under sections of the IPC, Arms Act and UAPA. This is the case of a larger conspiracy as after Dabholkar’s murder, comrade Govind Pansare, rationalist M M Kalburgi and journalist Gauri Lankesh were killed. The conspiracy is not over. We don’t know who will be killed next. The CBI is investigating and Punalekar if released on bail will tamper with the evidence,” Suryavanshi argued.
